26/**
27 * DOC: atomic modeset support
28 *
29 * The functions here implement the state management and hardware programming
30 * dispatch required by the atomic modeset infrastructure.
31 * See intel_atomic_plane.c for the plane-specific atomic functionality.
32 */
33
34#include <sys/cdefs.h>
35__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_atomic.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:24 riastradh Exp $");
36
37#include <drm/drmP.h>
38#include <drm/drm_atomic.h>
39#include <drm/drm_atomic_helper.h>
40#include <drm/drm_plane_helper.h>
41#include "intel_drv.h"
42
43/**
44 * intel_connector_atomic_get_property - fetch connector property value
45 * @connector: connector to fetch property for
46 * @state: state containing the property value
47 * @property: property to look up
48 * @val: pointer to write property value into
49 *
50 * The DRM core does not store shadow copies of properties for
51 * atomic-capable drivers. This entrypoint is used to fetch
52 * the current value of a driver-specific connector property.
53 */
54int
55intel_connector_atomic_get_property(struct drm_connector *connector,
56 const struct drm_connector_state *state,
57 struct drm_property *property,
58 uint64_t *val)
59{
60 int i;
61
62 /*
63 * TODO: We only have atomic modeset for planes at the moment, so the
64 * crtc/connector code isn't quite ready yet. Until it's ready,
65 * continue to look up all property values in the DRM's shadow copy
66 * in obj->properties->values[].
67 *
68 * When the crtc/connector state work matures, this function should
69 * be updated to read the values out of the state structure instead.
70 */
71 for (i = 0; i < connector->base.properties->count; i++) {
72 if (connector->base.properties->properties[i] == property) {
73 *val = connector->base.properties->values[i];
74 return 0;
75 }
76 }
77
78 return -EINVAL;
79}
80
81/*
82 * intel_crtc_duplicate_state - duplicate crtc state
83 * @crtc: drm crtc
84 *
85 * Allocates and returns a copy of the crtc state (both common and
86 * Intel-specific) for the specified crtc.
87 *
88 * Returns: The newly allocated crtc state, or NULL on failure.
89 */
90struct drm_crtc_state *
91intel_crtc_duplicate_state(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
92{
93 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state;
94
95 crtc_state = kmemdup(crtc->state, sizeof(*crtc_state), GFP_KERNEL);
96 if (!crtc_state)
97 return NULL;
98
99 __drm_atomic_helper_crtc_duplicate_state(crtc, &crtc_state->base);
100
101 crtc_state->update_pipe = false;
102
103 return &crtc_state->base;
104}
105
106/**
107 * intel_crtc_destroy_state - destroy crtc state
108 * @crtc: drm crtc
109 *
110 * Destroys the crtc state (both common and Intel-specific) for the
111 * specified crtc.
112 */
113void
114intel_crtc_destroy_state(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
115 struct drm_crtc_state *state)
116{
117 drm_atomic_helper_crtc_destroy_state(crtc, state);
118}
119
120/**
121 * intel_atomic_setup_scalers() - setup scalers for crtc per staged requests
122 * @dev: DRM device
123 * @crtc: intel crtc
124 * @crtc_state: incoming crtc_state to validate and setup scalers
125 *
126 * This function sets up scalers based on staged scaling requests for
127 * a @crtc and its planes. It is called from crtc level check path. If request
128 * is a supportable request, it attaches scalers to requested planes and crtc.
129 *
130 * This function takes into account the current scaler(s) in use by any planes
131 * not being part of this atomic state
132 *
133 * Returns:
134 * 0 - scalers were setup succesfully
135 * error code - otherwise
136 */
137int intel_atomic_setup_scalers(struct drm_device *dev,
138 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
139 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state)
140{
141 struct drm_plane *plane = NULL;
142 struct intel_plane *intel_plane;
143 struct intel_plane_state *plane_state = NULL;
144 struct intel_crtc_scaler_state *scaler_state =
145 &crtc_state->scaler_state;
146 struct drm_atomic_state *drm_state = crtc_state->base.state;
147 int num_scalers_need;
148 int i, j;
149
150 num_scalers_need = hweight32(scaler_state->scaler_users);
151
152 /*
153 * High level flow:
154 * - staged scaler requests are already in scaler_state->scaler_users
155 * - check whether staged scaling requests can be supported
156 * - add planes using scalers that aren't in current transaction
157 * - assign scalers to requested users
158 * - as part of plane commit, scalers will be committed
159 * (i.e., either attached or detached) to respective planes in hw
160 * - as part of crtc_commit, scaler will be either attached or detached
161 * to crtc in hw
162 */
163
164 /* fail if required scalers > available scalers */
165 if (num_scalers_need > intel_crtc->num_scalers){
166 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Too many scaling requests %d > %d\n",
167 num_scalers_need, intel_crtc->num_scalers);
168 return -EINVAL;
169 }
170
171 /* walkthrough scaler_users bits and start assigning scalers */
172 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(scaler_state->scaler_users) * 8; i++) {
173 int *scaler_id;
174 const char *name;
175 int idx;
176
177 /* skip if scaler not required */
178 if (!(scaler_state->scaler_users & (1 << i)))
179 continue;
180
181 if (i == SKL_CRTC_INDEX) {
182 name = "CRTC";
183 idx = intel_crtc->base.base.id;
184
185 /* panel fitter case: assign as a crtc scaler */
186 scaler_id = &scaler_state->scaler_id;
187 } else {
188 name = "PLANE";
189
190 /* plane scaler case: assign as a plane scaler */
191 /* find the plane that set the bit as scaler_user */
192 plane = drm_state->planes[i];
193
194 /*
195 * to enable/disable hq mode, add planes that are using scaler
196 * into this transaction
197 */
198 if (!plane) {
199 struct drm_plane_state *state;
200 plane = drm_plane_from_index(dev, i);
201 state = drm_atomic_get_plane_state(drm_state, plane);
202 if (IS_ERR(state)) {
203 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Failed to add [PLANE:%d] to drm_state\n",
204 plane->base.id);
205 return PTR_ERR(state);
206 }
207
208 /*
209 * the plane is added after plane checks are run,
210 * but since this plane is unchanged just do the
211 * minimum required validation.
212 */
213 if (plane->type == DRM_PLANE_TYPE_PRIMARY)
214 intel_crtc->atomic.wait_for_flips = true;
215 crtc_state->base.planes_changed = true;
216 }
217
218 intel_plane = to_intel_plane(plane);
219 idx = plane->base.id;
220
221 /* plane on different crtc cannot be a scaler user of this crtc */
222 if (WARN_ON(intel_plane->pipe != intel_crtc->pipe)) {
223 continue;
224 }
225
226 plane_state = to_intel_plane_state(drm_state->plane_states[i]);
227 scaler_id = &plane_state->scaler_id;
228 }
229
230 if (*scaler_id < 0) {
231 /* find a free scaler */
232 for (j = 0; j < intel_crtc->num_scalers; j++) {
233 if (!scaler_state->scalers[j].in_use) {
234 scaler_state->scalers[j].in_use = 1;
235 *scaler_id = j;
236 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Attached scaler id %u.%u to %s:%d\n",
237 intel_crtc->pipe, *scaler_id, name, idx);
238 break;
239 }
240 }
241 }
242
243 if (WARN_ON(*scaler_id < 0)) {
244 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Cannot find scaler for %s:%d\n", name, idx);
245 continue;
246 }
247
248 /* set scaler mode */
249 if (num_scalers_need == 1 && intel_crtc->pipe != PIPE_C) {
250 /*
251 * when only 1 scaler is in use on either pipe A or B,
252 * scaler 0 operates in high quality (HQ) mode.
253 * In this case use scaler 0 to take advantage of HQ mode
254 */
255 *scaler_id = 0;
256 scaler_state->scalers[0].in_use = 1;
257 scaler_state->scalers[0].mode = PS_SCALER_MODE_HQ;
258 scaler_state->scalers[1].in_use = 0;
259 } else {
260 scaler_state->scalers[*scaler_id].mode = PS_SCALER_MODE_DYN;
261 }
262 }
263
264 return 0;
265}
266
267static void
268intel_atomic_duplicate_dpll_state(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
269 struct intel_shared_dpll_config *shared_dpll)
270{
271 enum intel_dpll_id i;
272
273 /* Copy shared dpll state */
274 for (i = 0; i < dev_priv->num_shared_dpll; i++) {
275 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll = &dev_priv->shared_dplls[i];
276
277 shared_dpll[i] = pll->config;
278 }
279}
280
281struct intel_shared_dpll_config *
282intel_atomic_get_shared_dpll_state(struct drm_atomic_state *s)
283{
284 struct intel_atomic_state *state = to_intel_atomic_state(s);
285
286 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&s->dev->mode_config.connection_mutex));
287
288 if (!state->dpll_set) {
289 state->dpll_set = true;
290
291 intel_atomic_duplicate_dpll_state(to_i915(s->dev),
292 state->shared_dpll);
293 }
294
295 return state->shared_dpll;
296}
297
298struct drm_atomic_state *
299intel_atomic_state_alloc(struct drm_device *dev)
300{
301 struct intel_atomic_state *state = kzalloc(sizeof(*state), GFP_KERNEL);
302
303 if (!state || drm_atomic_state_init(dev, &state->base) < 0) {
304 kfree(state);
305 return NULL;
306 }
307
308 return &state->base;
309}
310
311void intel_atomic_state_clear(struct drm_atomic_state *s)
312{
313 struct intel_atomic_state *state = to_intel_atomic_state(s);
314 drm_atomic_state_default_clear(&state->base);
315 state->dpll_set = false;
316}
